overview: From 2025-12-01 to 2026-01-01, elizaos-plugins/plugin-farcaster had 2 new PRs (3 merged), 0 new issues, and 9 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: add embed/media processing support for Farcaster casts
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
This PR adds support for processing embeds and media in Farcaster casts, enabling agents to better understand and respond to image and link content.

## Changes
- Add `EmbedManager` for handling embeds/media in casts
- Add image description generation using vision models (defaults to gpt-4o-mini)
- Add URL content extraction and summarization
- Update `interactions.ts` to process embeds and include media context
- Add attachment hint to message text for proper ATTACHMENTS provider selection
- Add test scripts for embed processing
- Bump version to 1.7.2

## New Features
- Automatic image analysis using OpenAI Vision
- Link content extraction and summarization
- Configurable embed processing via `IMAGE_DESCRIPTION` model setting

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Adds first-class embed/media handling for Farcaster casts and surfaces media to the agent runtime.
> 
> - New `EmbedManager` processes Neynar `embeds` (images, videos, audio, webpages, frames, quoted casts) and converts them to `Media` with optional vision-based image descriptions
> - `interactions.ts` now processes embeds for mentions/replies, adds `(Attachments: ...)` hint, and includes `attachments` in memory content
> - Types updated: `Cast` now carries raw `embeds` (Neynar) and processed `media`; utilities include embeds in `neynarCastToCast` and add attachments in `createCastMemory`
> - Public exports for embed utilities from `src/index.ts`; adds `scripts/test-embed-processing.ts` for manual verification
> - Bumps package version to `1.7.2`, adds `@elizaos/cli` dev dep, and updates `.gitignore` entries
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5649b1d1f254f40c6a689253b9b779ea518d2195. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added support for processing embedded media from Farcaster casts, including images, videos, audio, webpages, and frames.
  * Integrated AI vision model capabilities to automatically generate descriptions for image embeds.
  * Enhanced memory attachments to include processed media metadata.

* **Chores**
  * Version bump: 1.7.0 → 1.7.2.
  * Added new dev dependency for CLI tools.

<sub>✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.</sub>

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Use messaging service
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Unifies Farcaster interaction handling via Message/Cast services, adds a thread context provider, switches build to Bun, and standardizes logging/error handling.
> 
> - **Farcaster core**:
>   - **Unified interaction handling**: `FarcasterInteractionManager` now delegates mention processing to `runtime.messageService.handleMessage`; adds webhook/polling sources with factory and deduplication.
>   - **MessageService enhancements**: refactors cast-to-message mapping, adds `getThread`, and normalizes send/get methods and metadata.
>   - **Service wiring**: `FarcasterService` instantiates and exposes `getMessageService`/`getCastService`; structured logs and health check details.
> - **Actions & Events**:
>   - Update actions (`sendCast`, `replyCast`) to use Message/Cast services, return `void`, enforce 320-char limit, and use `runtime.logger`.
>   - Event handlers (`messageHandler`) store/augment cast metadata and switch to `runtime.logger`.
> - **Providers**:
>   - Add `farcasterThreadProvider` and export via `farcasterProviders`; improve profile/timeline providers with better errors and logging.
> - **Managers**:
>   - Interaction source split into polling/webhook with structured error logging; posting manager logs and scheduling robustness.
> - **Tests**:
>   - E2E/suite updated to use `getCastService`/`getMessageService`, add send/retrieve, reply threading, and health checks.
> - **Build & Config**:
>   - Migrate build to Bun (`build.ts`), add `tsconfig.build.json`, adjust `package.json` scripts; minor TS config changes.
>   - Config validation tweaks (`ZodError.issues`) and logging of validated settings.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 1c123ae256ec0dbee01e34f1e7187fd6db88db8d. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added a Farcaster thread provider to fetch and present conversation context.

* **Refactor**
  * Switched project build to a Bun-driven build flow.
  * Centralized message handling via a unified message service.
  * Updated Farcaster terminology from "Post" to "Cast".
  * Standardized logging across handlers and services; updated handler return shapes.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved error handling and validation reporting.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: refactor: DRY improvements and consistent logging
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Code quality improvements and DRY refactoring for the Farcaster plugin.

## Changes

### DRY Improvements
- **`getFarcasterFid()` helper**: New centralized function for FID retrieval with proper parsing and null handling
- **Simplified `hasFarcasterEnabled()`**: Removed redundant `character.settings` checks since `getSetting()` already prioritizes character settings

### Consistent Logging
- **Use `runtime.logger` everywhere**: Replaced all standalone `logger` imports with `runtime.logger` or `this.runtime.logger`
- Improves per-agent log context and traceability

### Test Suite Improvements  
- **Per-agent credential checking**: Tests now check `hasFarcasterEnabled(runtime)` at runtime
- **Mock/real test switching**: Automatically runs mock tests when credentials unavailable
- **Configuration diagnostics**: Added standalone config check test

## Technical Notes

The original PR attempted to prioritize `character.settings` over `getSetting()`, but this was redundant since `getSetting()` already checks in this order:
1. `character.secrets`
2. `character.settings`
3. `character.settings.secrets`
4. Environment variables

## Credits
Co-authored-by: rferrari <rferrari@users.noreply.github.com>

Closes #13

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> **Scope**: Code quality and DX improvements across Farcaster plugin, services, managers, events, providers, and tests.
> 
> - Introduces `getFarcasterFid(runtime)` and simplifies `hasFarcasterEnabled(runtime)` to rely on `runtime.getSetting`, reducing env/setting duplication
> - Standardizes logging by replacing global `logger` with `runtime.logger`/`this.runtime.logger` across actions, services, managers, event handlers, providers, and tests
> - Enhances config validation: `validateFarcasterConfig` now logs via `runtime.logger` and prefers runtime settings; trims redundant env fallbacks
> - Test suite now conditionally runs real or mock scenarios per agent using `hasFarcasterEnabled`; adds a standalone "Check Farcaster Configuration" test and improves E2E scenarios to use `getFarcasterFid`
> - Services (`CastService`, `MessageService`, `FarcasterService`) refactored to use `getFarcasterFid` and runtime-scoped logging; health check reads FID via helper
> - Managers and interaction sources use runtime-scoped logging; webhook/polling handling preserved with clearer messages
> - Build: generate type declarations via `bunx tsc`
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 4ba41cd5636475698bf55111a8a2c3ffeaca38bb. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: Improve Farcaster Configuration Handling & API Updates (v1.0.6)
topPRs.author: rferrari
topPRs.body:
This PR introduces several improvements to the Farcaster plugin, focusing on enhanced configuration flexibility, updated API method names, optional callback handling, and better test coverage for configuration validation. It also bumps the plugin version to **1.0.6**.

---

## Configuration & Credential Handling
- **Prioritize character-level settings** in `config.ts` when resolving Farcaster credentials (`FARCASTER_FID`, `FARCASTER_SIGNER_UUID`, `FARCASTER_NEYNAR_API_KEY`).
- Support credentials provided in `runtime.character.settings` and under `secrets.*` namespaces.
- Added detailed **debug logging** for configuration resolution and validation, making it easier to troubleshoot missing credentials.
- Enhanced `validateFarcasterConfig()` to include structured debug output for key Farcaster parameters.

---

## Test Suite Improvements
- Introduced a **configuration validation test** (`testConfiguration`) to verify the Farcaster setup for each agent at runtime.
- Reworked `FarcasterTestSuite` to dynamically determine whether to run **real or mock tests** based on available credentials.
- Added structured and readable console output for configuration states and credential presence.
- Introduced mock test fallback logic (`credentialedOrMockTest()`) to avoid unnecessary test failures when Farcaster credentials are not provided.

---

## API Updates & Deprecation Cleanup
- Replaced deprecated method calls:
  - `getPostService` → `getCastService`
  - `createPost` → `createCast`
  - `getPosts` → `getCasts`
- Ensured consistent naming across E2E scenarios for better alignment with the latest Farcaster SDK.

---

## Interaction Handling
- Updated `callback` in `interactions.ts` to make file parameters **optional**, improving flexibility for integrations without attachments.

---

## E2E Scenarios
- Updated test cases to use `getCastService` and `createCast` consistently.
- Improved error handling and logging for `getMentions()` and `getCasts()` results.
- Added safeguards for mock vs. real testing modes.

---

## Changelog

| Type | Description |
|------|--------------|
| **feat** | Prioritize character settings in Farcaster configuration |
| **fix** | Make callback files optional |
| **fix** | Replace deprecated Farcaster API methods (`getPosts`, `createPost`, etc.) |
| **chore** | Update plugin version to `1.0.6` |
| **test** | Add configuration validation and mock fallback tests |

---

## Version
`@elizaos/plugin-farcaster` → **v1.0.6**

---

## Why This Matters
These changes improve developer experience and plugin stability by:
- Allowing multi agents to define Farcaster credentials directly in character settings.
- Reducing false negatives in tests when environment variables are missing.
- Ensuring alignment with the latest Farcaster SDK changes.
- Simplifying integration testing and debugging workflows.

---

## Testing
- **Unit Tests:** All pass successfully  

```bash
bun run test:unit
$ vitest run __tests__/unit

 RUN  v3.2.4 /projects/plugin-farcaster

 ✓ src/__tests__/unit/common/types.test.ts (29 tests) 26ms
   ✓ Profile Type > should accept valid profile with all properties 2ms
   ✓ Profile Type > should accept profile with only required properties 1ms
   ✓ Profile Type > should handle edge case values 0ms
   ✓ Cast Type > should accept valid cast with all properties 2ms
   ✓ Cast Type > should accept minimal cast with only required properties 1ms
   ✓ Cast Type > should handle empty text and zero stats 1ms
   ✓ CastId Type > should accept valid cast id 0ms
   ✓ CastId Type > should handle empty hash and zero fid 0ms
   ✓ FidRequest Type > should accept valid fid request 1ms
   ✓ FidRequest Type > should handle boundary values 0ms
   ✓ LastCast Interface > should accept valid last cast 0ms
   ✓ LastCast Interface > should handle zero timestamp 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should validate complete valid configuration 3ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should apply default values when optional fields are missing 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should transform string booleans to actual booleans 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should throw error for invalid FARCASTER_FID 2ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should throw error for missing required fields 2ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should throw error for empty required strings 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterEventTypes Enum > should contain all expected event types 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterEventTypes Enum > should have exactly 3 enum values 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterEventTypes Enum > should allow valid enum assignments 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterMessageType Enum > should contain all expected message types 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterMessageType Enum > should have exactly 2 enum values 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterMessageType Enum > should allow valid enum assignments 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterGenericCastPayload Interface > should accept valid payload structure 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterGenericCastPayload Interface > should handle minimal payload structure 0ms
   ✓ Type Integration Tests > should create a complete workflow with all types 0ms
   ✓ Type Integration Tests > should validate configuration with realistic values 0ms
   ✓ Type Integration Tests > should handle edge cases across all types 0ms

 Test Files  1 passed (1)
      Tests  29 passed (29)
   Start at  18:45:41
   Duration  495ms (transform 98ms, setup 0ms, collect 121ms, tests 26ms, environment 0ms, prepare 103ms)
```

---

- **Manual Validation:** Confirmed proper detection of credentials

```bash
...
 Debug      [hasFarcasterEnabled] FID: Found
 Debug      [hasFarcasterEnabled] Signer UUID: Found
 Debug      [hasFarcasterEnabled] API Key: Found
 Debug      [validateFarcasterConfig] Resolved FID: 1
 Debug      [validateFarcasterConfig] Resolved Signer UUID: Found
 Debug      [validateFarcasterConfig] Resolved API Key: Found
 Log        Farcaster Client Configuration:
 Log        - FID: 1
 Log        - Dry Run Mode: enabled
 Log        - Enable Cast: enabled
 Log        - Cast Interval: 90-180 minutes
 Log        - Cast Immediately: disabled
 Log        - Action Processing: enabled
 Log        - Action Interval: 1000 minutes
 Log        Farcaster client initialized in dry run mode - no actual casts should be posted
 Info       [SUCCESS] Farcaster Neynar client initialized.
 ...
```

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Chores**
  * Version bumped to 1.0.6

* **Refactor**
  * App terminology migrated from post-centric to cast-centric naming
  * Configuration detection expanded to prefer secret sources and now emits debug logs for resolved values

* **Tests**
  * Per-test credential-aware mode added to run real or mock variants and surface configuration status

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Mention callback accepts an optional files parameter; unhealthy health details now logged as strings
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topContributors.summary: standujar: This month, standujar made substantial contributions across the `elizaos` ecosystem, focusing on core system stability, refactoring, and introducing new capabilities. They implemented a new Unified API for serverless Node.js environments (elizaos/eliza#6201) and delivered several complex fixes, most notably optimizing the pre-1.6.5 migration and RLS handling in the SQL plugin (elizaos/eliza#6215), which involved over 28k lines of changes. In addition to merging seven pull requests, they have eight open PRs that introduce significant new features like JWT authentication and widespread streaming support. Their work was distributed across bug fixes, feature development, and refactoring, with a strong emphasis on code and test files.

wtfsayo: Focused on client-side fixes and plugin migrations this month, merging two pull requests in the elizaos/eliza repository. They improved the user experience by fixing markdown content spacing (#6197) and migrated the SQL plugin to the new messageService API (#6202). Additionally, they have begun work on a new core feature for parallel action execution (#6209), with their overall contributions reflecting a primary focus on bug fixes and refactoring.

madjin: Focused on enhancing core functionality and maintaining project dependencies this month, merging three pull requests in the `elizaos/elizaos.github.io` repository. They implemented and fixed a new RSS feed feature (#172, #175) and also managed a substantial dependency update by upgrading the AI SDKs in a large PR (#170) with over 3300 new lines. Their work was a mix of bug fixes, feature implementation, and significant maintenance, touching both code and configuration files.

0xbbjoker: This month, 0xbbjoker's work was primarily focused on bug fixes, contributing a significant volume of code changes across 68 files (+3655/-1134 lines). They merged one feature enhancement to the MCP provider (elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp#19) and proactively opened an issue to improve the agent creator's file handling (elizaos/eliza#6245). In addition to their direct code contributions, they were an active collaborator, providing 6 code reviews for their peers.

odilitime: Undertook a substantial amount of work this month, reflected in 25 commits across 25 files (+2146/-592 lines). While this work has not yet been merged via a pull request, their coding activity shows a focus on bugfixes and refactoring. They also contributed by creating an issue in elizaos-plugins/plugin-mysql (#1).

ChristopherTrimboli: Focused on core feature development and dependency management, introducing ElizaOS Cloud as the default AI provider in the CLI (elizaos/eliza#6208) and executing a significant dependency update across the ecosystem (elizaos/eliza#6210). In addition to merging these two PRs, he supported the team by providing 4 code reviews. His work primarily involved modifications to configuration and test files, reflecting a focus on system health and testing alongside feature work.

borisudovicic: Focused entirely on product definition and quality assurance for the elizaos/eliza repository this month. They created 41 issues, identifying a wide range of bugs, user experience enhancements, and new feature proposals. This work included documenting critical fixes like the container deployment bug (#6187) and proposing significant UX changes such as redesigning the dashboard (#6222) and consolidating navigation (#6173). All activity was concentrated on identifying and scoping improvements for the elizaos/eliza application.

lalalune: Made a substantial contribution this month by merging a large-scale chore/refactor in the elizaos/eliza repository (PR #6213), which involved over 16,000 lines of code changes. They also began work on a major new feature with the "Eliza Cloud Integration" pull request (#6216) and identified a crash condition that was subsequently resolved (elizaos/eliza#6204). Their activity shows a primary focus on a mix of bugfixes, feature work, and refactoring across the codebase.

DevGruGold: This month, DevGruGold initiated new work in the elizaos/eliza repository, opening two pull requests (#6220, #6219). While no contributions were merged, these open PRs represent a substantial effort, containing over 1900 lines of code changes across 13 commits. This work, a mix of bug fixes and other tasks, was primarily focused on modifying configuration, documentation, and test files.

prajwal-pl: This month, prajwal-pl focused on feature development, opening a pull request to improve message service handlers with asynchronous operations (elizaos/eliza#6279). This work represents a substantial effort, with a single commit modifying 8 files and adding over 700 lines of code. Their activity was concentrated entirely on this new feature.
0xtechdean: This month, 0xtechdean's efforts were directed toward documentation, opening a pull request to add AVS docs for the cursor/twitter agent (elizaos/eliza#6265).

AntoineVergne: This month, AntoineVergne's work focused on expanding the plugin ecosystem by adding the new 'plugin-farcaster-local-hub' to the registry (elizaos-plugins/registry#243). This feature contribution consisted of a single-line update to a configuration file. They also provided one comment on a pull request.

todoencadena: Activity this month was focused on bot integration, opening a pull request to fix the Telegram bot for Railway (elizaos/eliza#6214). This work involved a single commit with minor changes to a configuration file.

Tonyflam: This month, their contribution focused on expanding the plugin ecosystem by adding the new `@tonyflam/plugin-openchat` plugin to the registry via PR elizaos-plugins/registry#242. This work consisted of a minor update to a configuration file.

tdnupe3: This month, tdnupe3's efforts were directed towards planning new payment functionalities. They initiated this work by creating issue elizaos/eliza#6244, which proposes an implementation guide for integrating Circle and Coinbase APIs for AI agent payments.

nguyennk92: This month, their focus was on refactoring database connection logic in the `elizaos/eliza` repository. They opened a pull request (#6262) proposing to remove the reassignment of the runtime database to individual connections. This work represents a targeted effort to improve connection management.
linear: Focused on server reliability by identifying and documenting an issue related to concurrent connection timeouts in elizaos/eliza (#6198).
github-advanced-security: No activity this month.

pereslavlland: This month, pereslavlland's activity was focused on bug reporting within the elizaos/eliza repository. They identified and opened issue #6211 to document a problem with snapshot eligibility and Tangem wallet connections, and also contributed one comment to an issue.
flaviobruno72: Contributed by identifying a potential performance issue in the `elizaos/eliza` repository, opening issue #6267 to report a long wait time.
